card.name: Question #1
card.question: In what type of chemical reaction is chemical energy released as heat?

card.name: Question #2
card.question: What are the six basic types of chemical reactions?
card.answer: Combustion, Synthesis, Single Displacement, Decomposition, Double Displacement, and Acid-Base

card.name: Question #3
card.question: Oxygen combines with other substances to create what during combustion?

card.name: Question #4
card.question: Two simple substances combining to create a more complex substance is known as what?

card.name: Question #5
card.question: When some atoms from one substance are transferred to another it is known as what?

card.name: Question #6
card.question: A complex substance braking down into simpler substances is what?

card.name: Question #7
card.question: When atoms of one substance are exchanged with those of another it is known as what?

card.name: Question #8
card.question: Acid-Base is what type of chemical reaction between acids and bases?

card.name: Question #9
card.question: Electricity was first utilized in which century?

card.name: Question #10
card.question: Static electricity occurs when what jumps from one object to another?

card.name: Question #0
card.question: Since electricity must come from another form of energy it is known as what type of energy source?

card.name: Question #12
card.question: Energy needs to act through what to be utilized?

card.name: Question #13
card.question: Electricity is generated when what in a substance are passed along a conductor?

card.question: Name three sources of electricity

card.name: Question #15
card.question: The two types of an electrical charge are what?

card.name: Question #16
card.question: Which formula, developed by Einstein, is used to calculate the amount of energy?

card.name: Question #17
card.question: Calories are a form of which type of energy?

card.name: Question #18
card.question: True or False: Light and Sound are both types of energy.

card.name: Question #19
card.question: A unit of energy is normally measured as what?

card.name: Question #20
card.question: Solar energy's source is what?

card.name: Question #21
card.question: Power generated from water is known as what?

card.question: An object in motion produces what type of energy?

card.question: To calculate kinetic energy, what must be known of the object?

card.name: Question #24
card.question: Kinetic energy occurs in which direction?

card.name: Question #25
card.question: What happens to an object;s kinetic energy if its mass doubles?

card.name: Question #26
card.question: What happens to an object's kinetic energy if its mass doubles?

card.name: Question #27
card.question: True or False: The faster an object moves, the less kinetic energy it has.

card.name: Question #28
card.question: How is kinetic energy transferred between objects?

card.name: Question #29
card.question: What are the two types of kinetic energy?

card.name: Question #30
card.question: Motion through space is which type of kinetic energy?

card.name: Question #31
card.question: Motion centered on an axis is which type of kinetic energy?

card.name: Question #32
card.question: What is the speed of light?

card.name: Question #33
card.question: How long does it take light from the Sun to reach Earth?

card.name: Question #34
card.question: True or False: The speed of light changes when traveling through different objects.

card.name: Question #35
card.question: Light is which type of energy?

card.name: Question #36
card.question: Light is made of what?

card.name: Question #37
card.question: The intensity of photons is dependent on what?
card.answer: The amount of energy they contain.

card.name: Question #38
card.question: Different colors are generated by what?

card.name: Question #39
card.question: Energy cannot be what?

card.name: Question #40
card.question: What are the three types of potential energy?

card.name: Question #41
card.question: An object not resting on the ground has what type of potential energy?

card.name: Question #42
card.question: Gravitational Energy does what the heavier the object and the higher off the ground it is?

card.name: Question #43
card.question: Which type of potential energy is stored in objects that are stretched or compressed?

card.name: Question #44
card.question: Energy stored in fossil fuels is which type of potential energy?

card.name: Question #45
card.question: How does an object come to posses potential energy?
card.answer: It must be changed by some force.

card.question: Sound is measured by what?

card.question: Sound travels how fast?

card.question: The study of sound is known as what?

card.question: Thermal energy relates to what property of an object?

card.question: True or False: Head and temperature are not the same.
